item.title: Nvm
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

[quote=“adu, post:12, topic:305330”][quote author=yong min link=topic=401573.msg2976773#msg2976773 date=1254340097]

Edit the values in the java file if it isn’t saving them on the editor. Happened to me before, and had to edit the values in the java file and worked perfectly.

ur kidding right? are you talking about the source code of the sprite editor?

how would that help some sprites have different values… lol

but i think that might be my problem its not saving the values when i save the .png as a sprite

No I wasn’t kidding lol. You manually edit the values every sprite. Obviously you don’t keep the same value for all sprites fool.

Do as Adam said.

@Adam, didn’t know that worked You really should released the fix for it that you did
[/quote]

Theres no point lol…Cause hitting refresh will do the same thing anyways :P[/quote]

Haha yeah. We had this conversation months ago, about the sprite editor. Will remember the refresh button for the future

Thanks Adam <3

Read full topic

item.title: Nvm
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

[quote=“Iron Maiden, post:9, topic:305330”][quote author=yong min link=topic=401573.msg2976670#msg2976670 date=1254334893]
Edit the values in the java file if it isn’t saving them on the editor. Happened to me before, and had to edit the values in the java file and worked perfectly.
[/quote]

ur kidding right? are you talking about the source code of the sprite editor?

how would that help some sprites have different values… lol

but i think that might be my problem its not saving the values when i save the .png as a sprite[/quote]

After you stick in your values for shifts and other stuff, hit refresh, then save your sprite. That will make it save.

snoopy i looked at it but it still aint working i load the image change the values to what the original sprite is

then i save that image as a sprite and still. btw the images have the same dimensions as the original…

the thing is that it might not be saving the values because i load back the sprite i saved into the editor and the values are back to 0. when u put in the values is there something else you gota do other than save the image into a sprite?

dam this is confusing.

item.title: Nvm
item.dc:creator: @kakur007 kakur007
item.description:
@kakur007 wrote:

[quote=“Iron Maiden, post:4, topic:305330”][quote author=kakur007 link=topic=401573.msg2976575#msg2976575 date=1254327059]
I bet you forgot to edit something in sprite editor, like Shifts(x-Shift, Y-Shift) also width and height. Try to play with them around and you’ll get ur images into correct place.
[/quote]

explain this what does shifts have to do with the way the sprite is saved?
i might be wrong but when you save a sprite from an image does not save in the same pixels as it came from the image?[/quote]
Sorry my bad, bit tired and didn’t read ur post correctly! Sorry :o

Read full topic
